flawed_nl_solution:
On 80 games, Daniel spend 80 games * $12/game = $<<80*12=960>>960.
The rest of the collection is 346 games - 80 games = <<346-80=266>>266 games.
50/100 of these games means 50/100 * 266 games = <<50/100*266=532/1>>532/1 games.
Daniel bought them for $7 each, so he had to spend 532/1 games * $7/game = $<<532/1*7=3724>>3724 on them.
The other -266 games were bought for $3 each, so they've cost him -266 games * $3/game = $<<-266*3=-798>>-798.
On all games in total Daniel spent $960 + $3724 + $-798 = $<<960+3724+-798=3886>>3886.
#### 3886

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 133, not 532/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
